roleset.name: motivate to do something
roleset.note: GALVANIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'galvanize' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1, verbs of emotion, which seems inappropriate. (from galvanize.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: all args
example.text: The tragedy, he adds, ``galvanized me'' to look for a way to prevent similar cases.
example.arg: to look for a way to prevent similar cases

example.name: unstated action
example.text: Their report galvanized other molecular biologists.

roleset.name: cause a response
roleset.note: GALVANIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'galvanize' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1, verbs of emotion, which seems inappropriate. (from galvanize.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: Newton was right!
example.text: They say these are small prices to pay for *trace* galvanizing action for the all-important cause.

roleset.name: coat iron/steel with zinc
roleset.note: GALVANIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'galvanize' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1, verbs of emotion, which seems inappropriate. (from galvanize.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: industrial applications are scarce
example.text: John devised a new process for *trace* galvanizing barbed wire.
